intro: Eupatorium paucidentatum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved thoroughwort, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, woodland habitats and features narrow, lance-shaped leaves with a distinctive white or pale green underside. Its showy, purple-tinted flowers bloom in late summer, attracting various pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Eupatorium paucidentatum is often found in wetlands and along stream banks, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
